required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Solesta for Treatment of Fecal Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Non-comparative, Post-marketing, Multi-center Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of SolestaTM for the Treatment of Fecal Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of Solesta as an injectable bulking agent in the treatment of fecal incontinence for a total of 24 months after completed treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate in Number of Fecal Incontinence Episodes
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after last treatment compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Responder rate in number of fecal incontinence episodes change from baseline at 12 month. Defined as responders at 12 month after treatment. A responder was defined as 50% or more reduction in the number of fecal incontinence episodes (28-day diary data)of solid or loose stool, compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of fecal incontinence episodes, change from baseline (change in patient diary data at 12 month).

secondary_outcome.measure: Fecal Incontinence Severity Using the Cleveland Clinic Florida Incontinence Score
secondary_outcome.description: Cleveland Clinic Florida Incontinence Score (CCFIS) is a composite score of incontinence severity that measures the frequencies of gas leakage, leakage of solid or loose stool, use of protective pads and lifestyle alterations. The score ranges from 0 (representing complete continence)to 20 (representing complete incontinence). Change from baseline.

Fecal Incontinence Quality of Life is a disease specific questionnaire composed of a total of 29 questions questions divided into four domains: Lifestyle, Coping/Behavior, Depression/Self perception, and Embarrassment. The FIQL mean score ranges from 1 to 4 for the Lifestyle, Coping/Behavior and Embarrassment domains, and from 1 to 4.429 for Depression/Self-Perception domain. Mean score were calculated for each of the four domains. The more the subject is affected by fecal incontinence the lower value. Change from baseline.
Number of incontinence-free days, change from baseline (change in patient diary data at 12 month).

arm_group.description: Open label. Solesta (Dextranomer in gel of stabilized non-animal hyaluronate) The study treatment consisted of 4 submucosal injections, 1 mL Solesta each, in the proximal part of the high pressure zone in the anal canal. Re-treatment is allowed one month after initial treatment if the subject is still incontinent.

intervention.intervention_name: Solesta (Dextranomer in gel of stabilized non-animal hyaluronate)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-80 years of age, male or female
- Screening fecal incontinence severity score (CCFIS)
- Fecal incontinence episodes over a 28-day period
- Failed conservative treatment for fecal incontinence
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complete external sphincter disruption
- Significant anorectal disease
- Anorectal surgery within the last 12 months prior to the study
- Active Inflammatory Bowel Disease
- Immunodeficiency or receiving immunosuppressive therapy
- Malignancies in remission for less than 1 years prior to the study
- Bleeding disorders or receiving anticoagulant therapy
- Chemotherapy within the last 6 months prior to the study
- Prior Pelvic radiotherapy
- Pregnant or breast-feeding women, or women of childbearing potential not practicing adequate contraception or planning to stop such contraception within the first year of the study
- Women within 6 months post partum
- Participation in any other clinical study within 3 month prior to the study
- Other severe conditions or in other ways unsuitable to participate according to investigator judgement

overall_official.last_name: Head of Medical Affairs Q-Med AB

facility.name: CHU de Rouen 1 rue Germont service de chirurgie et digestive
University of Bari - Coloproctological Unit of Bari Policinico di Bari Piazza
Univ. degli Studi di Padova Hospital Clinica Chirurgica

group.title: Solesta
group.description: Open label. Solesta (Dextranomer in gel of stabilized non-animal hyaluronate) : Submucosal injections. Re-treatment is allowed one month after initial treatment if the subject is still incontinent.

group.title: Solesta
group.description: Open label. Solesta (Dextranomer in gel of stabilized non-animal hyaluronate) : Submucosal injections. Re-treatment is allowed one month after initial treatment if the subject is still incontinent.

outcome.title: Responder Rate in Number of Fecal Incontinence Episodes
outcome.description: Responder rate in number of fecal incontinence episodes change from baseline at 12 month. Defined as responders at 12 month after treatment. A responder was defined as 50% or more reduction in the number of fecal incontinence episodes (28-day diary data)of solid or loose stool, compared to baseline.
outcome.time_frame: 12 months after last treatment compared to baseline
outcome.population: Intention to treat (all subjects who were treated with study product). Primary analysis were based on observed data. A Last-Observation-Carried -Forward (LOCF) technique was also used where the last performed efficacy assessment was carried forward to impute any subsequent missing values.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
